post.author: goliathvt
post.body:
I'm going to be picking this one up in a few days once I beat Far Cry 2... it looks massive and impressive... the graphics aren't quite as top-notch as, say Crysis, Far Cry 2 or Mass Effect... it seems like some of the models have lower poly-counts than I would have hoped, but the game is dripping in atmosphere and I don't need visuals to be perfect if the story and gameplay are decent.

The Gametrailers narrator mentions in his video review that the game packs in so much stuff that it can be overwhelming. I actually love this notion... he basically says it's daunting to try to get to everything in one character's play-through, which to me translates to replay-ability freshness. For example, I'm the kind of person who's replayed Mass Effect and tried to choose missions, squad-mates and dialog options that were sort of the opposite from my first play-through style and I've enjoyed it quite a bit.

From what I've read and seen about Fallout 3, the dialog seems a little cheesy at times. I don't mind it for a straight up FPS like Far Cry 2 or Crysis, but an RPG... not sure about that.

I also like the "target body part" 3rd-person cam action/battle system idea... I still need to read a bit more on how it works but it "looks cool" so far from what I can tell.

Again, this is all based on the reading and video reviews and footage that I've seen... I won't have a chance to play the game 'til November.

post.author: mavrik65
post.body: It's looking pretty good pc gamer said it's not as good as oblivion but it's worth buying. The thing with rpg's is that I get bored of the freedom before I "complete" the game and grinding to me sounds so pointless, imho games are about relaxing and having fun not working by doing the same repetitive task over and over. The graphics seem to be what I expect of a modern game not too amazing but not out dated. I've seen graphics like that on most 360 games, it definitely ain't crysis. But on the plus side they've made the game gorey which is brilliant because there hasn't been that many gorey games since aliens vs predator 2. And gore just gives a game that finer degree of destruction. And destruction is what it's all about .

post.author: BloodRayne
post.body:
I am playing Fallout 3 with no preconceptions whatsoever, my only experience with RPG's is Mass Effect, and I never played Oblivion.
I keep hearing there are 'no shadows' in FO3, I guess this must be an issue with their particular systems, as I have shadows and everything looks pretty good to me.

Not having played Oblivion 3 I didn't know what to expect and so far I like what I've seen. I think Mass Effect is a little more balanced over all but that's hardly noticeable. All in all I like the experience of Fallout 3. The graphics are pretty sweet and the overall mood of it all is as grim as I'd like it to be.

All in all 8/10, so far.
